title: Die Verurteilung des Lukullus
text:
Die Verurteilung des Lukullus ("The Condemnation of Lucullus") is an <a href="opera">opera</a> by <a href="Paul%20Dessau">Paul Dessau</a> to a libretto by the German dramatist <a href="Bertolt%20Brecht">Bertolt Brecht</a>.
Brecht's dramatic text for the opera is more or less identical to that of the radio-play "<a href="The%20Trial%20of%20Lucullus%20%28play%29">The Trial of Lucullus</a>", which was written in 1938–9.
Performance history.
The opera was first performed under the latter's title at the <a href="Berlin%20State%20Opera">Berlin Staatsoper</a> on 17 March 1951, conducted by <a href="Hermann%20Scherchen">Hermann Scherchen</a>, with stage design by <a href="Caspar%20Neher">Caspar Neher</a>. It was withdrawn, revised, and reinstated with its present title on 12 October 1951.
The opera was broadcast on the radio in an English-language translation by the <a href="BBC">BBC</a>'s <a href="BBC%20Third%20Programme">Third Programme</a> on 20 March 1953.
In November 2021, the <a href="Staatsoper%20Stuttgart">Staatsoper Stuttgart</a> mounted a new production of the opera, directed by Franziska Kronfoth and Julia Lwowski and staged by the musical-theater-collective "Hauen und Stechen". The performances were conducted by contemporary music specialist <a href="Bernhard%20Kontarsky">Bernhard Kontarsky</a> and featured tenor <a href="Gerhard%20Siegel">Gerhard Siegel</a> as "Lukullus" and soprano/mezzo-soprano <a href="Cheryl%20Studer">Cheryl Studer</a> as "Tertullia".
Recording.
recorded 1964, Leipzig, <a href="Herbert%20Kegel">Herbert Kegel</a>
